On Fri, 2004-09-10 at 10:30, sharpe_simon wrote:

> Sudents should write the set and get methods and set values 
> correctly so this test is passed.

Sounds like a wonderful idea.

> 
> Problem : - I want them to work through the exercises and tests one 
> at a time, but the test class will obviously not compile until all 
> of the correct methods are in place in the Book class.
> Is my approach to this incorrect. Is there better way?

I think your approach is quite correct. Of course the test won't compile
until the Book class is written.
First step is to write the test (which you have done).
Next step is to compile the test -- the students need to realize they
need to write the beginning of the Book class with the appropriate
constructor and method signatures. 

Next step is to make the test pass by adding sufficient logic to the
methods.



> 
> Hope you can help. 

I hope this did.  This is the approach I take in writing virtually all
my code now days. It works extremely well. 

Frank

-- 
Frank Burough <fburough@...>
